questions.question_text: Which is the Cisco recommended layout if cascading is being used?

discussion.content: Configure the CLI commands no supplementary-service sip refer , no supplementary-service sip moved-temporarily under voice service voip configuration mode for call transfer and call forward scenarios in Unified CME.

questions.question_text: A voice engineer is setting up a Cisco 2951 Integrated Services Router with Cisco Unified Communications Manager Express. To enable voice features for SIP endpoints, which command must the engineer enter?

An engineer is troubleshooting call quality issues between two sites. On an active voice call, the call statistics on the IP phone show that the max jitter is 100 ms.
What is the maximum amount of jitter that the engineer can allow and still expect to maintain a high-quality audio call?

discussion.content:
Correct answer is -> C

Acceptable VoIP jitter is no more than 30 ms.
This is a low tolerance. Although you can begin to see a drop in call quality at 30 ms, the detrimental effects are at 100 ms of jitter. Jitter in a VoIP system can be a quality of service (QoS) issue

Answer: D

Explanation

There are some recommended requirements for high-quality voice calls:

+ End-to-end (one-way) delay: 150 ms or less
+ Jitter: 30 ms or less
+ Packet loss: 1% or less

(Reference: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/tech/tk652/tk698/technologies_tech_note09186a00800945df.shtml and CCNA Voice 640-461 Official Certification Guide)

questions.question_text: An engineer is using a cascading feature with Cisco TelePresence Conductor and Cisco TelePresence Servers. Which two limitations will the engineer likely encounter? (Choose two.)

choices.E: Ad-hoc conferencing cascading is supported only with three or more Cisco TelePresence Servers. AC
choices.A: Ad-hoc conferencing cascading is not supported.
choices.B: Only single-screen endpoints are supported through cascading links.
choices.D: Multiple-screen endpoints are supported only with three or more Cisco TelePresence Servers.

questions.question_text: A company requires a video conferencing solution where users have to dial an Auto Attendant to join the session bridge. Which bridge do you recommend?
